com.collabnet.ccf.core
Class AbstractReader<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.core.lifecycle.LifecycleComponent
          com.collabnet.ccf.core.AbstractReader<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.openadaptor.core.IComponent, org.openadaptor.core.IDataProcessor, org.openadaptor.core.jmx.Administrable, org.openadaptor.core.lifecycle.ILifecycleComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
ProjectTrackerReader, SampleReader, SFEEReader
public abstract class AbstractReader<T>
extends org.openadaptor.core.lifecycle.LifecycleComponent
implements org.openadaptor.core.IDataProcessor

AbstractReader provides the abstraction of shipping Generic Artifacts through the wiring components. It provides three methods for the plugin developers to implement. The plugin developer should implement these methods by extending the AbstractReader. The AbstractReader then gets the changed artifacts from the implemented methods and sorts them according to their last modified date and sends them across. It sends the artifacts one per Open Adaptor cycle. The process method implements the streaming logic.

Author:
madhusuthanan (madhusuthanan@collab.net)

Method Detail

init

private void init()
Initializes the Reader with an empty repository records HashMap. The repositories synchronization waiting list and the repository ids in the waiting list are also initialized. It also creates a comparator that will be used to compare a set of GenericArtifacts. The comparator compares the GenericArtifacts according to the last modified date of the artifacts.

process

public java.lang.Object[] process(java.lang.Object data)
The process method queues the sync info documents from the sync info readers. It then takes each repository one by one and asks the repository reader (which is a sub class to this AbstractReader) if there are any changed artifacts. If the reader gives a list of artifacts that are changed then the AbstractReader requests the repository reader to get the data of the changed artifacts one by one along with the dependent artifact data such as attachments and dependent artifacts in the Generic Artifact xml format. On getting these data the abstract reader emits the artifacts one by one to the next component in the pipeline. It does this for each repository alternatively so that all the repositories get equal chance to ship their artifacts. If there are no artifacts to be shipped for all of the repositories configured then the AbstractReader pauses the processing for sleepInterval milliseconds.

Specified by:
process in interface org.openadaptor.core.IDataProcessor

removeFromWaitingList

private void removeFromWaitingList(RepositoryRecord currentRecord)
Removes the record passed in the parameter from the waiting list so that in the further runs this repository will not be taken into account for artifact shipment (Unless the repository record is added again by the incoming synchronization record).

Parameters:
currentRecord - - The repository record to be removed from the waiting list.

moveToTail

private void moveToTail(RepositoryRecord currentRecord)
Moves the repository to the tail of the waiting list so that in the next immediate run the repository will not be considered for synchronization (Unless it is the lone repository that is being sync-ed).

Parameters:
currentRecord - - The repository record to be moved to the tail.

combineAndSort

private java.util.List<GenericArtifact> combineAndSort(java.util.List<GenericArtifact> artifactData,
                                                       java.util.List<GenericArtifact> artifactAttachments,
                                                       java.util.List<GenericArtifact> artifactDependencies)
All the artifact data and dependent data generic artifacts are accumulated in a single List and are sorted according to their last modified date so that the artifact that was changed early will ship first.

Parameters:
artifactData - - The artifact's data
artifactAttachments - - Attachments of an artifact
artifactDependencies - - Dependent artifacts
Returns:
- The sorted list of Generic Artifact objects

getArtifactDependencies

public abstract java.util.List<GenericArtifact> getArtifactDependencies(org.dom4j.Document syncInfo,
                                                                        java.lang.String artifactId)
Sub classes should implement this method. The implemented method should get all the dependent artifacts of the artifact with the artifact id artifactId and convert them into Generic Artifact object and return. If there are no dependent artifacts to be returned the implemented method should return an empty List. It should not return null.

Parameters:
syncInfo - - The synchronization info against which the changed artifacts to be fetched
artifactId - - The id of the artifact whose dependent artifacts should be retrieved and returned.
Returns:
- A List of dependent artifacts of this artifactId that are changed

getArtifactAttachments

public abstract java.util.List<GenericArtifact> getArtifactAttachments(org.dom4j.Document syncInfo,
                                                                       java.lang.String artifactId)
Queries the source repository for any attachment changes for the given artifactId and returns the changed attachments in a GenericArtifact object. If there are no attachments changed an empty list is returned.

Parameters:
syncInfo -
artifactId -
Returns:

getArtifactData

public abstract java.util.List<GenericArtifact> getArtifactData(org.dom4j.Document syncInfo,
                                                                java.lang.String artifactId)
Returns the artifact data for the artifactId in a GenericArtifact object. If the reader can return the artifact change history it should be returned in the list. If the reader doesn't have the capability of returning the artifact change history it should return a list that contains the latest artifact data in a single GenericArtifact object added to the list.

Parameters:
syncInfo -
artifactId -
Returns:

getSleepInterval

public long getSleepInterval()
Returns the configured sleep interval in milliseconds

Returns:

setSleepInterval

public void setSleepInterval(long sleepInterval)
Sets the sleep interval in milliseconds. Sleep interval is the time lag introduced by the AbstractReader when there are no artifacts to be shipped in any of the repositories configured.

Parameters:
sleepInterval -

isShipAttachments

public boolean isShipAttachments()
Returns whether the attachments of the artifact should be shipped by the Reader component.

Returns:
- true if the attachments will be shipped. - false if the attachments won't be shipped.

setShipAttachments

public void setShipAttachments(boolean shipAttachments)
Sets the flag whether to ship the attachments or not.

Parameters:
shipAttachments - - true if the attachment should be shipped - false if the attachments should not be shipped.

getMaxAttachmentSizePerArtifact

public long getMaxAttachmentSizePerArtifact()
Returns the maximum attachment size that will be shipped for an artifact. The max attachment size is configured in bytes.

Returns:
- The maximum attachment size per artifact in bytes

setMaxAttachmentSizePerArtifact

public void setMaxAttachmentSizePerArtifact(long maxAttachmentPerArtifact)
Sets the maximum attachment size to be shipped for an artifact. If the attachment size is more than this configured value it should not be shipped by the reader.

Parameters:
maxAttachmentPerArtifact - - the maximum attachment size that can be shipped.

isIncludeFieldMetaData

public boolean isIncludeFieldMetaData()
Returns the flag that denotes if the Reader should include field meta data for the artifacts that are shipped.

Returns:
- true if the field meta data should be shipped - false if the field meta data need not be shipped by the Reader.

setIncludeFieldMetaData

public void setIncludeFieldMetaData(boolean includeFieldMetaData)
Sets if the field meta data should be included in the artifact by the Reader component.

Parameters:
includeFieldMetaData - - true if the Reader should include the meta data for the fields. - flase if the Reader need not include the field meta data with the artifact fields.

getConnectionManager

public ConnectionManager<T> getConnectionManager()
Get the connection manager. The connection manager is responsible to manage (create, close, pool) the connections from type T. Furthermore, it contains timeout settings and the settings for the retry code in case of network timeout and session fault related errors.

Returns:
the connection manager object

setConnectionManager

public void setConnectionManager(ConnectionManager<T> connectionManager)
Set the connection manager. The connection manager is responsible to manage (create, close, pool) the connections from type T. Furthermore, it contains timeout settings and the settings for the retry code in case of network timeout and session fault related errors.

Parameters:
connectionManager - the connection manager object
